dt: {bc}stimulation or encouragement resulting in increased activity
{bc}the property possessed by a moving body {d_link|in virtue of|virtue} its mass and its motion
used of bodies moving suddenly or violently to indicate the origin and intensity of the motion

quotes.t: But 1939 gave new {qword}impetus{/qword} to the Western with the Cecil B. de Mille railway epic {it}Union Pacific{/it}, John Ford's skillful and dramatic {it}Stagecoach{/it},  … and George Marshall's classic comic Western, {it}Destry Rides Again{/it}.

In a revealing comment, Mr. Updike says an {qword}impetus{/qword} for {it}Rabbit, Run{/it} was the "threatening" success of Jack Kerouac's {it}On the Road{/it}, the signature book of the 1950s Beat Generation, and its frenetic search for sensation.

… new techniques of navigation and shipbuilding enlarged trade and the geographical horizon; newly centralized power absorbed from the declining medieval communes was at the disposal of the monarchies and the growing nationalism of the past century gave it {qword}impetus{/qword} …

et: Latin, assault, impetus, from {it}impetere{/it} to attack, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}petere{/it} to go to, seek {ma}{mat|feather|}{/ma}
shortdef: stimulation or encouragement resulting in increased activity
